domestic_issues.name: Mice
domestic_issues.description: Mice are small rodents that infiltrate homes looking for food, water and shelter. They are nocturnal, so it is common to find them active during the night. They often leave traces such as feces, footprints or gnaw marks on walls, furniture and stored food. They are also extremely agile, capable of squeezing through spaces as small as the diameter of a pencil.
domestic_issues.danger: Mice not only damage materials such as wood and electrical wiring, but also carry serious diseases such as hantavirus, salmonellosis and leptospirosis. Their droppings and urine can contaminate food and preparation surfaces. In addition, gnawed cables pose a risk of short circuits and fires.
domestic_issues.solution: To control mice, inspect and seal any cracks or holes in the home using caulk or steel grates, store food in airtight containers and clean up crumbs regularly. Place mechanical or glue traps near walls where mice roam and, if the infestation persists, contact a professional exterminator for a comprehensive solution.

domestic_issues.name: Faulty Electrical Outlet
domestic_issues.description: An electrical outlet that is not working properly, may spark, or is loose.
domestic_issues.danger: Faulty outlets can cause electrical shocks, fires, and damage to electronic devices.
domestic_issues.solution: If you are not comfortable working with electricity, call a qualified electrician. Otherwise, turn off the power to the outlet and inspect for loose wires or damage.

domestic_issues.name: Leaky Faucet
domestic_issues.description: A faucet that drips water continuously or when turned off.
domestic_issues.danger: Leaky faucets can waste water and increase your water bill. They can also lead to water damage over time.
domestic_issues.solution: You may be able to fix a leaky faucet by replacing the washer or O-ring. If you cannot fix it yourself, call a plumber.

domestic_issues.name: Broken Appliance
domestic_issues.description: A household appliance that is not working as it should, such as a refrigerator, stove, or washing machine.
domestic_issues.danger: Broken appliances can cause inconvenience and potential safety hazards, such as electrical fires or gas leaks.
domestic_issues.solution: Try troubleshooting the appliance yourself or consult the owner's manual. If you cannot fix the problem, contact a repair technician.

domestic_issues.name: Pest Infestation
domestic_issues.description: The presence of unwanted pests, such as ants, cockroaches, or rodents, in your home.
domestic_issues.danger: Pest infestations can cause damage to your home, spread diseases, and create unsanitary conditions.
domestic_issues.solution: Identify the type of pest and take appropriate action, such as using traps, baits, or insecticides. For severe infestations, contact a professional pest control service.
